programme.desc: Capuchin Matty needs a visit from the vet after fighting leader Erico for the top spot, and the birth of a baby woolly monkey is captured on camera.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Theres big news for one of the chimp groups, and rescued marmoset Jangles summons up the courage to join her new mate Reggie in the outside enclosure.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Vet Nic Masters uses high tech diagnostic equipment to examine health issues in some of the parks smaller primates, including capuchin Louis and patas monkey Penelope.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The primate care staff move more than thirty capuchins in a day, the chimps react to a fallen tree and the guenons finally get to try out their revamped home.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimp Bryan has a trip to the dentist to remove a rotten molar, and Lee Butler returns to Vietnam to assess repairs needed at Monkey Worlds sister sanctuary.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough charts the story of animals who defy gravity, starting with the planets first flyers: the insect.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: After meeting some critters who glide through life in Borneo, Sir David Attenborough decides to turn back the clock.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: In the final episode in the series, Sir David Attenborough turns his attention to the creatures that dominate our skies today.

programme.title: Attenborough At 90: Behind the Lens
programme.desc: In celebration of Sir David Attenboroughs 90th Birthday, this intimate film presents new interviews, eye-opening behind-the-scenes footage and extraordinary clips from some of his most recent films.

programme.title: Attenboroughs Journey
programme.desc: Follow David Attenborough around the globe as he films David Attenboroughs First Life.

programme.title: A David Attenborough Special
programme.desc: On his 89th birthday, David Attenborough talks about his career, his recent record-breaking dive on the Great Barrier Reef and issues facing the natural world today.

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David descends beneath the waves at night in the state of the art Triton submersible, the first of its kind to visit the reef. He meets some of the tiny coral animals that built the reef and helped to turn it into an underwater wonderland.

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David continues his exploration of the Great Barrier Reef, aboard the research vessel the Alucia. He discovers the incredible animals that visit the reef every year, from birds to whales, some travelling thousands of kilometres to get there.

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David examines what the next few decades hold for this remarkable community of animals, as well as what is being done to save it.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough journeys across the globe to discover how the earliest animals developed on our planet. Attenborough meets expert fossil hunters, and sees on-site some of the most remarkable finds that have transformed our understanding of the first animal life forms, including the first set of eyes and teeth and the first predators and parasites.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: Sir David Attenboroughs journey continues in Canadas Rocky Mountains, where fossils document an explosion in animal diversity never seen before or since. Travelling on to North Africa, the rainforests of Australia and the east coast of Scotland, Attenborough discovers how animals evolved to conquer not only the oceans but also the land and air.

programme.title: The Bachelor King
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a birds-eye view in this spectacular documentary, charting the king penguins attempts to survive, find love and raise a family in the unforgiving Antarctic.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Right beneath our feet is a secret world of disguise and espionage, social networking and courtship, rape and pillage, parenthood and relationships. Sir David Attenborough investigates how macroscopic residents outwit their enemies to survive.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Its a bug-eating world out there, and the documentary continues with a look at how the various critters disable the defences of their respective prey.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Dating is just as tricky a business in the insect world, and Sir David Attenborough finds out how certain bugs choose and then woo their partners.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough reveals how different bugs usher in the next generation, including the butterfly and harvestman spider.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Join Sir David Attenborough as he zooms in on a set of bugs who prefer co-operation to conflict. Features the likes of the burrowing cockroach and the queen bee.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough takes a tour of the insect worlds vast colonies, which rival human megacities in terms of size and complexity.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Rise of Animals: Triumph of the Vertebrates
programme.sub-title: From the Seas to the Skies
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses fossil evidence and CGI to reveal the story of the vertebrates, from their humble origins as the primitive fish that once swam in ancient seas, to their radical move onto land and beyond.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Rise of Animals: Triumph of the Vertebrates
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses fossil evidence and CGI to reveal how mammals developed from tiny forest dwellers to become the dominant life form on the planet.

programme.desc: On day four of the 2025 World Darts Championship, the evening session gets underway at Alexandra Palace in London.

programme.title: PDC World Darts Championship
programme.desc: Highlights from day sixs evening session at the 2025 World Darts Championship at Alexandra Palace in London.

programme.title: PDC World Darts Championship
programme.desc: Highlights from day fives afternoon session at the 2025 World Darts Championship at Alexandra Palace in London.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2014 World Grand Prix: James Wade v Robert Thornton
programme.desc: Revisit an incredible match at the 2014 World Grand Prix of Darts, as James Wade and Robert Thornton both hit nine-darters during their round two meeting. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 1997 World Championship: Eric Bristow v Phil Taylor
programme.desc: Revisit a semi-final from the 1997 World Darts Championship that pitted Eric Bristow, who was enjoying one of his greatest runs in the PDC, up against Phil Taylor. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2015 Premier League: Michael van Gerwen v James Wade
programme.desc: Revisit a classic Premier League Darts contest from the Motorpoint Arena where Michael Van Gerwen dismantled James Wade in 2015 with an average of 116.90. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2002 World Matchplay Quarter-Final: Phil Taylor v Chris Mason
programme.desc: In a match that saw the first-ever televised nine-darter, revisit this classic contest between Phil Taylor and Chris Mason at the 2002 World Matchplay. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2016 World Championship: Raymond van Barneveld v Michael van Gerwen
programme.desc: In 2016, Michael Van Gerwen and Raymond Van Barneveld delivered a World Championship thriller on the Alexandra Palace stage. Revisit this epic encounter in London. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2004 World Championship: Phil Taylor v Kevin Painter
programme.desc: Trailing Kevin Painter 4-1, a ninth World Championship title looked out of reach for Phil Taylor. Cue a miraculous recovery and a breathtaking sudden death leg. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2017 World Matchplay: Phil Taylor v Peter Wright
programme.desc: Appearing for the final time on the Winter Gardens stage, revisit Phil Taylors World Matchplay Final with Peter Wright in 2017. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2010 Grand Slam Quarter-Final: Steve Beaton v Phil Taylor
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the 2010 Grand Slam of Darts, Steve Beaton staged an incredible comeback, overcoming Phil Taylor. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2005 World Championship Quarter-Final: Peter Manley v Adrian Lewis
programme.desc: During the World Championship in 2006, Peter Manley and Adrian Lewis clashed in an ill-tempered quarter-final at the Circus Tavern. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2007 World Championship: Phil Taylor v Raymond van Barneveld
programme.desc: Take a look back at the 2007 World Championship final between Phil Taylor and Raymond Van Barneveld. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2017 US Darts Masters: James Wade v Dawson Murschell
programme.desc: Overcoming the nerves of a TV debut, Canadian youngster Dawson Murschell announced himself to the world during this classic contest against James Wade in 2017. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2011 World Matchplay: Andy Hamilton v Simon Whitlock
programme.desc: In a classic at the World Matchplay in July 2011, Simon Whitlock let a seemingly unassailable lead slip when Andy Hamilton recovered from a 15-8 deficit. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2014 World Championship: Phil Taylor v Michael Smith
programme.desc: Revisit the 2014 PDC World Darts Championship where Phil Taylor suffered a shock second-round defeat to then unknown Michael Smith. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics
programme.sub-title: 2004 World Championship: Phil Taylor v Kevin Painter

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Everything but the Kitchen Sink!; German Shepherd Attack!; Parents of 16 Children
programme.desc: Exes fight over money; a man sues for vet bills; a couple sue their daughter for rent.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Botched Limo to the Prom!; Father Daughter Rental Dispute
programme.desc: A teen claims a botched limo service ruined prom; a woman and her father sue her former landlord.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: The Van Man; Teen Mom Damages?; Dog and Truck Collision
programme.desc: A woman sues over an illegally repossessed van; a teen sues her childs father.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Hard Times; Lease Liability?; Heart Attack Damage
programme.desc: Judge Judy Sheindlin, a judge from New York, tackles real-life small claims cases with a no-nonsense attitude.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: The killers of Charles Lynch tried to burn his body to cover their crime, but a forensic examination revealed 24 stab wounds. The hunt was on for at least two murderers.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Following four sexual assaults in Indiana in 1996, a man is arrested and convicted but, six years later, forensic developments reveal new facts about the case.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A young couple are killed in what appears to be a drug deal gone wrong, but at tests reveal that the couple were clean. Can their pet dog Chief lead the police to the real culprits?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a Presbyterian minister called 911, medics found his wife dying in the bathtub, having ingested large quantities of medication. Was it murder or suicide?

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A girl on her way back from a rock concert blew a tyre on her truck. The police found the vehicle, but no trace of her. Three years later, they made a grisly discovery.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: A young dancer was elated to gain a place at the Houston High School for Performing Arts, but she fell in with a bad crowd, and suddenly disappeared without a trace.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Phillip Rouss Jr had it all family, friends and a thriving business. Until his health began to deteriorate. Tests revealed he was being poisoned, but by whom?

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: When a six year old disappeared, her father was the prime suspect. He failed a polygraph test, and even confessed, but ten years on the investigation was turned on its head.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: The discovery of a womans naked body, covered with bruises, leaves no doubt that she was the victim of foul play. Investigators erect a makeshift tent around the body and use Super Glue fumes to lift the killers palm print from the victims skin.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: In 2017, Ellen Higginbottom was murdered by Mark Buckley in Orrell Water Park, Wigan. After fleeing the scene with her laptop and phone, Buckley was caught by police.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: We explore the tragic murder of 18-year-old Lily Sullivan in Pembroke, Wales. After a brief encounter with 31-year-old Lewis Haines, Lilys life was cut short.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: Exploring the tragic story of Sarah Williams, whose obsession with former fireman Ian Johnston leads to the murder of his new partner, Sadie Hartley.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: In December 2013, the peaceful village of Bosham in West Sussex was rocked by the murder of Valerie Graves, a talented artist and grandmother.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: Michael OLeary is murdered by his best friend Andrew Jones after an affair with Andrews wife. Lured to Andrews farm under false pretences, Michael is executed.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: Examining the case of Georgia Williams, a seventeen-year-old from Shropshire, who was murdered by Jamie Reynolds, a disturbed individual who meticulously planned her death.

programme.title: Britains Countryside Killers
programme.desc: Exploring the murder of Emma Caldwell, a 27-year-old whose body was found in Limefield Woods in 2005. Iain Packer, a sign installer with a violent past, evaded justice for years.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Dog Abuse vs. Puppy Deaths?!; High Kick to Antique Dresser?!; Show Me Proof of Internal Bruising!
programme.desc: A teenager enters into her first dog-breeding contract only to be accused of abuse, police are called when a man reportedly kicks his landlords dresser, and a woman and her wife accuse a former roommate of assault.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: House Flipping Scam Artist?!; Pit Bull Mix Goes for Womans Throat?!; Unfair Child Support!
programme.desc: A man claims to have lost thousands of dollars while trying to get into the house-flipping business, a woman says she was attacked by a dog on a friends property, and a father is reprimanded for allowing his ex-girlfriend to pay for child support.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Vandalism Excuse at Its Finest?!; Amazing Townhouse Profit?!
programme.desc: A woman claims she caught her estranged friend cutting down all the mobiles on her front porch. A woman sells her home for three times what she paid for it and then sues a previous tenant for repairs.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Big Bucks Fish Tank Botch?!; Lovers Lexus Mix-Up!
programme.desc: A custom fish tank arrives at its destination damaged. Plus, a man claims that his ex-lover fraudulently registered his car under her name.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Hair Stylist Left in the Dark?!; Solar Tree Trimming Disaster?!
programme.desc: A stylist whose works electricity was switched off claims all of her property was stolen. Plus, a married couple sue a solar power salesman for damages.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Woman Desperate for Degrading Job?!; The Infamous Afghanistan Scam?!
programme.desc: A generous friend steps in when a woman claims that she is willing to work as a paid escort to cover her overdue bills. A woman sends money to a man she has never met in person who says that he is trapped in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Dove Release Runaround; Uber Driver Payback?!; Clueless Young Mother?!
programme.desc: When in need of a car, a woman claims she was forced to sign a ridiculous payback contract. Plus, a woman insists she is a great mother despite the fact that she cant remember the most basic details of a recent car sale.

programme.title: Judge Judy

programme.sub-title: The Wild Party Injury and the Uneducated Fool?!
programme.desc: After a woman walks into a rowdy party and is violently hit over the head with a chair, the judge explains that the liability lies with the teenage party planner.

programme.desc: A young woman is accused of breaking out windows of an ex-friends home after she sees a video of her boyfriend with someone else. After a woman has a miscarriage, her cousin sues her for moving too many people into their shared home.

programme.desc: A woman alleges her Bulldog rescue charity was forced to close after internet defamation and sues for $5000. The defendant claims funds were being misappropriated by the plaintiff.

programme.sub-title: New Career: Flipping Cars!; Creative Judgment!
programme.desc: A man tries to start a fix-and-sell cars company only to wind up suing a body shop owner. When the judge begins to question the legitimacy of a claim, she proposes the use of a mans appearance fee as payback for his debt.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: When Old Friends Become New Roommates; Frightened Painter Walks Off Job?
programme.desc: A man claims his friend and landlord evicted him by shutting off the electricity. The owner counters the tenant had damaged her property, and owed rent.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Unwed Parents Feud!; Twin Sisters, Huge Settlement?
programme.desc: Parents of two children fight over alleged vehicle vandalism, bleached clothes and a car crash. When a woman passes away, her twin daughters receive money from a negligence settlement and proceed to fight over unpaid loans.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Ambulance Ride Revisited!; New Get Out of Jail Clothes!
programme.desc: A mother sues the father of her five children for an unpaid ambulance bill. A woman wants to be paid back after taking her boyfriend on a shopping spree.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Busting at the Seams in Hot Springs!; Lawn or Love Business?!
programme.desc: When a property owner discovers that 24 vacationers will be taking over his rental property, he cuts their trip short. A woman claims unrequited love is the reason an ex-friend is coming after her for loans to start a lawn care business.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Disabled Helping the Disabled?; Highway Barricade Collision!
programme.desc: A woman is accused of racking up over $7000 in charges on her boyfriends debit card. A young mans mother is accused of suspicious insurance practices after he crashes a vehicle.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: A man suing for car damage caused doing repossession claims he was attacked by the repo man when his car was being towed.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Car Takes a Hood Pounding!; If Your Bed Is There, You Are There!
programme.desc: A man states he was trying to stop a car from running him down by pounding on the hood of the approaching vehicle. Underage drinking, noise complaints and ownership of a TV come into play when ex-roommates call it quits.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: Lies and heinous crimes of a Baton Rouge local TV celebrity and pastor spin a dark web of shocking secrets that tear his family apart and leave two dead.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: Sex, secrets, sports cars and money turn to murder in a quiet Memphis neighbourhood. And when the truth is uncovered, a mountain of lies comes crashing down.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: Emotions and intrigue run high in an suburb of Detroit, as a web of dark secrets, lies and hidden truths shock a community and rip a family apart - with murder.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: A Florida salons mysterious new stylist is hiding a terrible truth and shes willing to do anything to ensure her dark past remains hidden, including murder.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.sub-title: Gambled to Death (The Ernie and Charlene Scherer story)
programme.desc: All bets are off when a high-stakes game involving family secrets, lies, greed and infidelity explodes with deadly consequences.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: Big business and high rolling lifestyles turn deadly in a twisted, globe-trotting tale of deception, lies and murder.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: Hidden within a fairytale new marriage is a web of deceit, manipulation and secret love affairs that lead to shocking and deadly consequences.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: Bank robbing, deceptions and secret lives catch up with a serial liar, as his life spirals down a desperate, dark path that culminates in a brutal murder.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.desc: When childhood friends rekindle their romance, their seemingly perfect relationship unravels, leading to betrayal and murder.

programme.title: A Secret to Die For
programme.sub-title: Strange, Deadly Love (The Henry Strange Story)
programme.desc: Henry Stanges life is irrevocably altered after a serious motorcycle accident. Soon after, he falls into a deep depression and opioid addiction.

programme.title: Written In Blood
programme.desc: Simon Toyne travels to Darlington to investigate the case of Pater Chapman, dubbed `The Facebook Killer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Fit of Drunken Rage?!; Social Security Theft?!
programme.desc: A woman claims that her nephew vandalised her car and smashed a window in her house. A man accuses a family friend of stealing his government benefits.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Vindictive Tool Thief?!; Teen Driver Fail!
programme.desc: Divorced parents fight over tools and the cost of their teenage twins sports activities. A teenage driver admits to swerving into a car, and Judge Judy teaches his parents a valuable lesson.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Sister Love Gone Wrong!; Who Stole My Clarinet?
programme.desc: An ongoing feud involving bad credit and an expensive car divides sisters, and an unassuming friend gets involved. As ex-friends fight over a botched move, a clarinet, missing underwear and swim trunks come into play.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Paraplegics Dying Wishes Ignored?!; Mommy Stole My School Money!
programme.desc: A man saves money in a safe to be given to his roommate after he dies, and his sisters opening of it is called into question. A mother admits to taking her 19-year-old sons financial aid check and used it to cover household expenses.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Wheres My Harley Money?!; Choose a Defense ... Any Defense!; Moped Spill!
programme.desc: A woman claims her friend robbed her of $8000 when she asked him to sell her motorcycle. A man on a moped says he was hit by a car.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Dont Treat Me Like the Help!; Motorcycle Mystery!
programme.desc: A woman accuses her landlord of treating her like an employee. A woman waits nine years to sue her ex-boyfriend.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Repo Mama!; Military Man Browbeating?; Truck Sale Fraud?
programme.desc: A woman who tries to repossess a vehicle is arrested. A man has only seen his children once in six years. A man sues his neighbour.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Incarcerated Mechanic Runaround?!; Annoying New Girlfriend Alert!; High Speed Hit and Run?!
programme.desc: A man who was paid to do repairs never did them. A father brings his girlfriend to court. A woman sues her former friend for stealing and crashing her car.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Father Figure Accused of Evil Plot!; Phantom Driver at Fault?!
programme.desc: A man accuses his ex-girlfriends daughter of stealing money. A man gets into a car accident while trying to avoid a dog.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Rent Control and the American Dream!; Outrageous Drinking and Driving Excuse!
programme.desc: A man tries to get damages from his illegal tenant. A man is arrested for drunk driving and blames his ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Yappie Yorkie Takes a Hit?!; Worlds Worst Music Deal?!; Security Deposit Dog Drama!
programme.desc: A dog attacks a woman and her smaller dog. A singer is sued when they dont show up to a gig. An ex-tenant wants her security deposit but the landlord refuses.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Parties, Police and Payback?!; Bernese Mountain Dog Custody
programme.desc: Friends for more than 20 years end their relationship over an untenable living arrangement and a car impound. A man confesses that he breached an agreement to allow his dog to be used as a stud and shown by his breeder.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Man Endures Eight Rabies Shots After Attack!; Grief and Grit
programme.desc: A man takes his neighbour to court after being attacked by his two pit bulls. A woman mourns the loss of her father.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Vocab Lesson for Vandalizing Teenagers?!; I Wouldnt Sue My Son!
programme.desc: Teenagers accuse each other of infidelity and vehicle vandalism, and the judge teaches a young man new words. In a case involving a mother and sons battle over a car loan, Judge Judy makes it clear how she would have handled the dispute personally.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Evicted by Mom?!; My Father Defrauded Me!
programme.desc: Judge Judy mediates between a family who are feuding over unpaid rent. Plus, a woman accuses her father of renting under her name.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Screaming Dog Owners Gruesome Discovery!; Motorcycle Moocher?!
programme.desc: A neighbours American bullies are accused of breaking through a doggie door and killing two Chihuahuas. A shared love of motorcycles turns into an exchange of money and accusations of slander and assault.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Book Proposal Bust!; When Starving Retrievers Attack?!
programme.desc: Animal neglect issues are brought into the court when one dog is accused of attacking another. A woman accuses a writer she hired of delivering poor content.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: No One Talks to Judge Judy Like That!; Grief and Trauma Rental?
programme.desc: A man gets put in his place after he talks back to Her Honour. A woman wants her security deposit back after she leaves her apartment.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Study Abroad Freeloader?!; Road Rage With Children in the Car?!
programme.desc: A woman sues a motorist after a road rage incident. A mother sues her son when he goes to Paris with his girlfriend.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Sucker Punch During Family Brunch?!; No Help for Scammers?!
programme.desc: An outraged father demands justice after a youth is accused of displaying poor restaurant manners. Plus, a woman takes her brother in court to pay back a car loan.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Hospital Cat Fight Mayhem!; Its Not My Fault!
programme.desc: What begins as an inquiry into the health of an ill man quickly devolves into a fistfight between relatives at the foot of his bed. A woman accused of thievery claims she was forced out of her apartment and sues for return of rent.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Dont Make Babies if You Dont Have a Job!; Final Days for First Cousins; Kicking Cars and Drinking!
programme.desc: Two women have a skirmish over an unemployed man, a broken relationship between cousins results in apartment damages and ruined credit and a drunken man kicks a neighbours car during a party.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: UK Police investigate the murder of one of their own, PCSO Julia James. But with no witnesses or CCTV, they must rely on the community for their first lead.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: The body of a 17-year-old girl is found in an alleyway in Boltons red-light district. A tyre print is the polices only lead in a manhunt with dozens of potential suspects.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: A UK grandmother is found murdered with strange marks on her face after being spotted with an unknown male who turns out to be a killer posing as a child.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: A body is found in a pub freezer in the UK and police uncover suspicious texts. The main suspect is on the run, with forensic evidence pointing to his guilt.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: A drug dealer has been shot dead in Southampton, UK. With very little forensic evidence to go on, police must rely on the description of a witness who got away.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: When Sean Humphrey is found dead at home, police use forensic evidence to find a suspect. They uncover his identity, but catching him proves more difficult.

programme.title: Donal MacIntyres Killer Evidence
programme.desc: From serial killers to murder in the family and vicious gang killings, Donal MacIntyre investigates ten shocking crimes in the United Kingdom and the United States that are solved using forensics.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: I Was a Hitman for Primrose Dairies
programme.desc: Luther `Hobbo Hobdyke, a retired milkman with strong links to MI5, arrives in the village. Very soon, calling upon his experiences on numerous dangerous missions overseas as a master spy, he forms a small team of reluctant volunteers, consisting of Alvin and Entwistle ready to react to any emergency in the village. Finding that Hobbo has moved next door, Clegg and Truly recall that he was never much of a milkman.

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring tries to get out of attending a big church parade when the Home Guard are ordered to wear their medals from previous conflicts. The trouble is, Mainwaring hasnt got any.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Del envisages Christmas with a larger family than just Grandad and Rodney when he meets Heather.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Del and Rodney are bored with spending Christmas at home, so they decide to don their party clothes and head off for the night.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Dels application for a home improvement grant has been turned down by the local council, but at least he should be able to get tickets for the publicans party at the Nags Head. Meanwhile, Cassandra discovers something big.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: The Trotters finances hit an all-time low and wheeler-dealer Del tries to improve himself with a `new man manual. Meanwhile, with Cassandra expecting, Rodders decides he needs another job.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Raquel is worried about an important dinner party to which her parents have been invited. The problem is that the party is at the Trotter residence and she is the host.

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Mainwarings Home Guard platoon decides to give a turkey dinner to the old-age pensioners of Walmington-on-Sea.

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: It is Christmas in Dibley, and vicar Geraldine is about to pay a heavy price for Christian kindness. To avoid hurting anyones feelings she agrees to attend not one, not two, but three Christmas lunches.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve, and at the Goods house, Tom and Barbara are making decorations and crackers ready for Christmas Day, while at the Leadbetters, Margo has sent back her whole order because her Christmas tree is six and a quarter inches too short. However, when the company does not deliver her order the following day, she and Jerry are left with no decorations, food or drink. Can there be anything worse?

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...
programme.desc: Del and Rodney are bored with spending Christmas at home, so they decide to don their party clothes and head off for the night.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa and the Wests head east, with some help from Dave and his coach. Meanwhile in Essex, Dawn and Pete visit for drinks, Mick is preoccupied with his new love, and Smithy cannot wait to spend his first Christmas with Neil the Baby. Pam has prepared a lovely spread and Bryn has his mistletoe ready, but as the Christmas spirit gets a grip, Gavin and Stacey have a startling announcement to make.

programme.title: Blackadders Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve, 1850. Ebenezer Blackadder is a decent, kind, generous human being. However, as far as his loathsome ancestors are concerned, hes a wrong un. So as soon as he is snuggled up in bed they decide to pay him a visit.

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Tension mounts in the Royle household as the family contemplates the prospect of becoming fully laminated throughout. Dr Mahmoud prescribes new medication for Nana in the form of yellow tablets; coincidentally they turn out to be the same colour as the tablets that Joe was prescribed for the swelling when he got his bits stuck in his zip. Meanwhile, a mysterious ginger visitor reminds Nana of her favourite musical.

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Christmas festivities take an unexpected turn when Spudgun and Hedgehog turn up for dinner and Richie discovers a baby on the doorstep.

programme.desc: A yuletide feast with Harry Enfield, Paul Whitehouse and Kathy Burke.

programme.title: How To Build A Motor Car
programme.desc: A look at how Liverpool supercar manufacturer Briggs Automotive Company make their Â£270k BAC Mono R: the worlds first single-seat, road-legal supercar. With only 40 of the vehicles ever to be made in the world, this is precision engineering.

programme.title: World at War
programme.desc: America entered conflict after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, but the conflict in Europe and the conflict in the Pacific were two separate wars. Many Americans would have been content to forget about Hitler and Europe. Despite opposition from congress President Roosevelt, however, was committed to fighting Hitler. Eventually Hitler declared war on America, thus relieving Roosevelt of a difficult decision.

programme.title: World at War
programme.desc: The North Africa campaign, Montys Desert Rats against Rommels Korps, was about heat, thirst, flies, sandstorms and 600 miles of sand. The combatants speak.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head for the races as they arrive at Chepstow Racecourse in Wales. Family treasures featured include medals from early Olympic Games, awarded when tug-of-war was a competing sport; a light bulb containing a painstakingly-made model of Lincoln Cathedral gifted by a German prisoner of war in World War 2; and perhaps the oddest and one of the oldest pieces of glass ever featured on the programme.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A second visit for Fiona Bruce and the experts at Stowe School in Buckinghamshire brings thousands of visitors eager to discover more about their heirlooms. Featured on the programme are an MBE awarded to the surgeon who operated on George VI at Buckingham Palace and bestowed by the king in his dressing gown, and a single plate from `the finest porcelain dinner service ever made.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80s, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the worlds great plains - immense wilderness areas that seem empty, but which support the greatest gatherings of wildlife on earth, including two million gazelles on the Mongolian steppes, and three million caribou in North America. At the heart of all this is single living thing - grass - able to survive the baking savannahs of Africa, the frozen tundra of the Arctic, and the Indian floodplains.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the greatest woodlands on earth, from the evergreen forests of the frozen north to the deciduous dry forests of the equator. The Taiga forest is a silent world of stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice. By contrast, the broadleaf forests of North America and Europe bustle with life, while the baobab forests of Madagascar are the strangest of all, with bizarre upside-down trees.

programme.title: Allo Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are back in Renes cafe, having failed to escape, and Edith continues to gallivant around the village.

programme.title: Allo Allo!

programme.title: World at War
programme.desc: The German attempts to starve Britain by attacking ships bringing supplies from North America are very nearly successful. Many tonnes of shipping are sunk and many lives are lost to U-Boat attacks. Defeat in the Atlantic would surely mean the end of the war for the Allies.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts return to the Scarborough Spa Pavilion for another busy day. programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return to perhaps the most unusual venue to host the show - the active jet base of RAF Marham in Norfolk. programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Tropical rainforests cover just 3 per cent of our planet yet are home to a huge 50 per cent of the worlds species. They are the richest environments on earth but also the most competitive. Travelling through this enchanted world we uncover the amazing strategies the inhabitants adopt in order to survive. Look out for the flying frog mating orgy and the sinister bodysnatching Cordyceps fungi that eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
